intro: Litobrochia varians, commonly known as the variable rock cress, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to arid and rocky regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in crevices and on rocky outcrops, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Litobrochia varians is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds.
